Magnificent independent villa in Montenebro, Pedrezuela-Madrid.Magnificent for its dimensions and for its great qualities.The state of conservation is extraordinary.Its fully customized architecture makes it unique.It has three floors as can be seen in the attached plans, despite this it is perfectly designed to make your stay very comfortable. In the semi-basement floor it offers us a wonderful, cellar, room converted into a study/office, full bathroom, large storage room and pantry.On the ground floor, a large garage for two vehicles, laundry room and plumbing and electrical devices. A few meters away we have the main floor, giving us access to the majestic chalet, an automatic door made up of two large glass sheets with opening by presence detection, leads us to the large main hall and this to a beautiful kitchen with an office and a grandiose dining room with fireplace/cassette, with two well-differentiated environments, through an exclusive design staircase lined with wood with only two support points and sixteen steps, we disembark in a bright and elegant second living room with fireplace, with cassette, From there a few steps we have access to the large suite, it has a spacious and bright bedroom, dressing room and a crazy bathroom, with yacusi, sauna, and glass-enclosed shower, large marble countertop with two sinks. Returning to the main hall, in the other wing of the house, we access the rest of the bedrooms, in this case three and two full bathrooms. The house is completed by a gym, a beautiful porch, a wonderful barbecue area with a wood-burning oven where you can enjoy cooking fabulous barbecues, a 10x5m built-in pool with an exterior yacusi granite coping, a toilet and a storage room. The qualities of the house are extraordinary, exterior granite ceilings with sets of wooden beams, marble floors, ACS through solar energy panels, allow us not to spend a euro from March to November on diesel.In addition to a powerful diesel boiler and two 1,000-liter tanks, the house has a gas installation, to be able to connect to the network when it is installed.High-resistance exterior flooring, PVC interior carpentry with Climalit and mosquito nets, armored exterior doors and designer interiors in wood and aluminum fittings. An important work enclosure made up of twenty-three thousand bricks and a perimeter security system offer the desired protection for the safety of the house and its owners.

Rustic house registered in the Property Registry, located in a protected area, a heavenly place and in total privacy. The house is located a stone's throw from the Pedrezuela dam, especially when there is abundant water.Located in a protected area where it cannot be built again; The reservoir is between the house and the Atalaya Real Urbanization and there are no buildings next to the house, the dam is just past the fence. The property is fenced around its entire perimeter, part in stone and the rest in wire; of lush natural groves with junipers, oaks and wild plants, with empty spaces and spaces of groups of united oaks that are beautiful to enjoy. At the end of the photographic report I put the photos at another time of year where the vegetation is more vivid and the water from the dam is abundant. The house is wonderfully insulated from humidity, raised a few centimeters from the ground with air passage and the basement is also used for greater insulation and is also used as a storage room; As seen in the photos, it is very well protected by wide sidewalks and grates in its highest part to collect possible rainwater in the northern area; In the southern area, closer to the dam is the terrace with pergola, a room that can be a place for leisure and games and an old shepherd's shelter house with its oven. The house itself consists of an entrance hall, living room with fireplace, butane gas kitchen, main room with bathroom and a small room just to put bunk beds or use as an office whose measurements are 1.50 x 1.90; With a folding ladder you can access the open-plan attic with a very firm floor where, as seen in the images, some beds can be located (the height is small and it would only be used as a resting place since in its highest part there is no reaches the height of a person). The house does not have water or electricity connected; If you have the installations done and also an authorized well and septic tank.The water can be solved by enabling the well or with a water tank located in a high area that would fill the Canal de Isabel II itself.Regarding electricity, there is an Iberdrola transformer nearby and a light pole about 120 meters from the house. The house, as I say, is registered in the San Agustín Property Registry (it is a registered house on a protected rural property). The 105 m2 built includes the main house, the shepherd's house and the rest. Ideal for lovers of privacy and to enjoy the mountains and the dam; Just a few minutes away is the Guadalix nautical school for rowing or water skiing. The annual IBI expenses are 345 euros "There are NO AGENCY COSTS.".

Going up the stairs and reaching the first floor, the house has a full bathroom, three bedrooms, all with built-in wardrobes and the main one with a dressing area and en-suite bathroom.
